techmeme.title: Google says it will give a 71% discount to US federal agencies for Workspace, as it looks to capitalize on the Trump administration's cost-cutting push (Arsheeya Bajwa/Reuters)
Kevin Rose and Alexis Ohanian's Digg launches a $5 early-access program called Groundbreakers, giving a "front-row seat to how Digg is being rebuilt" (Sean O'Kane/TechCrunch)
Meta says LLMs have historically leaned left and wants to remove that bias with Llama 4 to "understand and articulate both sides of a contentious issue" (Emanuel Maiberg/404 Media)
A look at the internal chaos behind Apple's Siri failure, in part due to poor leadership, with John Giannandrea's AI/ML group dubbed "AIMLess" internally (Wayne Ma/The Information)
Source: ByteDance's revenue from international operations, which are primarily TikTok, rose 63% to $39B in 2024; overall revenue grew 29% to $155B (The Information)
